attributes.action: liase with the Football Association (via the offices of Sports Minister) to promote all U21 and Women's internationals at the New Wembly at reduced prices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: After the success of the U21 International 'Ramp Up ' event. It is self evident that the New Wembley Stadium's WOW factor is significant. However as Standard England International games will prove too expensive to a significant number of families outside of the capital and throughout the Nation. It is notable that the highest level of the national sport is today financially out of reach of the children, whom we should wish to become the participants of tomorrow. We propose that the FA and the Sport Minister review the premise that All U21 and Women’s Internationals are played at Wembley under reduced £10-£5 tariffs, as used on the 24th March 2007. We would suggest these games are played as ‘Double Headers’ to ensure that the youth of the nation is able to enjoy the experience of such a magnificent venue.
